thread.title: Musician's 5,000-square-foot Los Angeles pad has outdoor kitchen, pool
thread.title_full: Musician's 5,000-square-foot Los Angeles pad has outdoor kitchen, pool

title: Musician's 5,000-square-foot Los Angeles pad has outdoor kitchen, pool
text: Musician's 5,000-square-foot Los Angeles pad has outdoor kitchen, pool Shawn Cordon via TopTenRealEstateDeals.com A Los Angeles home once owned by Benny Goodman (1909-1986), the popular jazz clarinetist and bandleader known as the "King of Swing," has hit the market for $6.195 million, TopTenRealEstateDeals.com reports . The 5,000-square-foot Spanish-style home, built in 1928 in the Palisades Riviera area, features five bedrooms, six bathrooms, formal rooms, a family room, a large gourmet kitchen, a breakfast room, a study, and an outdoor living area with a kitchen and swimming pool. The property has been updated but includes period light fixtures and original details such as arched windows, wood-burning fireplaces and wrought-iron railing. For more information, visit TopTenRealEstateDeals.com .
